metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1120 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
WebKit, as used in Apple iOS before 8.3, Apple TV before 7.2, and AppleSafari before 6.2.5, 7.x before 7.1.5, and 8.x before 8.0.5, allows remoteattackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memorycorruption and application crash) via a crafted web site, a differentvulnerability than other WebKit CVEs listed in APPLE-SA-2015-04-08-1,APPLE-SA-2015-04-08-3, and APPLE-SA-2015-04-08-4.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1120` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-3.0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit-3.0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit2-3.0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-3.0-bin - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
libwebkit2gtk-3.0-25 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
libwebkitgtk-1.0-0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
libwebkitgtk-1.0-common - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
libwebkitgtk-3.0-0 - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
libwebkitgtk-3.0-common - 2.4.10-0ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: webkitgtk package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.10-0ubuntu1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no update available').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no update available').
